intro: Ageratina websteri, commonly known as the Webster's blueweed, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks. Its small, blue to purple flowers bloom in late summer, attracting various pollinators. Ageratina websteri is also noted for its use in traditional medicine by some Native American tribes.
